Package Cores

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
Cores.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment extends Object
Class that store game's data and manage the application

    • buyPurchasable

      public String buyPurchasable(int index)
      This method call Market.buyPurchasable(int) refer to Market.buyPurchasable(int) for further details
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the selected purchasable object
      Returns:
      A message as a feedback after this purchase also an indication rather this purchase is success

    • changeAtheleName

      public String changeAtheleName(Athlete athlete, String newName) throws Exception
      Change the selected athlete's name to a name entered by player, this method call Athlete.setName(String) to change name
      Parameters:
      athlete - The selected athlete
      newName - The new name entered by player
      Returns:
      A message describes the effect to the selected athlete
      Throws:
      Exception

    • launchStadium

      public void launchStadium()

    • matchStart

      public String matchStart(int index)
      This method is called when player select a match to compete, then create a new instance of Match with the two teams feed in the constructor, after that the selected match is removed and furthermore Match.matchBegin() and Match.matchResult() is called to construct a detailed message of the match. Lastly this method call {@link this#matchReward(Match)} to increase player's properties
      Parameters:
      index - This input indicate which match is selected by the player
      Returns:
      A detailed message of what happened in the match.

    • onFinish

      public void onFinish()
      This method should be called by the user interface when GameEnvironmentUi when the player has requested to quit. This method calls GameEnvironmentUi.quit() after confirming to quit

    • onSetupFinished

      public void onSetupFinished(String name, int gameLength, ArrayList<Athlete> startAthletes, CmdLineUi.Difficulty difficulty)
      This method should be called by user interface when GameEnvironmentUi.setup(GameEnvironment) is finished. This method call to signal user interface to start.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player
      gameLength - The length of this game
      startAthletes - The list of athletes that the player choose to start with
      difficulty - The difficulty of this game selected by player

    • refershMatches

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Athlete>> refershMatches()
      Generate a new list of matches
      Returns:
      A list contain list of new matches

    • removeAthlete

      public void removeAthlete(ArrayList<Athlete> team, Athlete target)
      Remove the targeted athlete in team
      Parameters:
      team - The team contains the targeted athlete
      target - The athlete to be removed

    • sellAthlete

      public String sellAthlete(Athlete athlete)
      This method call Market.sellAthlete(Athlete) refer to Market.sellAthlete(Athlete) for further details
      Parameters:
      athlete - The selected athlete
      Returns:
      A description describe how much player earned as a feedback

    • sellItem

      public String sellItem(int index)
      This method call Market.sellItem(int) to sell a item more info refer to Market.sellItem(int)
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the selected item
      Returns:
      A description of the process

    • setMoney

      public void setMoney(int newMoney)
      Set the money of this game to a new value
      Parameters:
      newMoney - The new value use to replace old value

    • start

      public void start()
      Start this game, initiate some basics games properties call GameEnvironmentUi.setup(GameEnvironment) to initiate the set up process

    • swapAthletes

      public String swapAthletes(Athlete active, Athlete reserve)
      Swap an active athlete with a reserve athlete
      Parameters:
      active - The active athlete to swap down
      reserve - The reserve athlete to swap up
      Returns:
      A String description as a feedback to signal player

    • takeABye

      public String takeABye()
      This method is called by player when player requested to end this week, heal all athletes by calling method healAthletes(), and refresh matches available and purchasable objects in market by calling refreshPurchasable() and refershMatches(). If current week is greater than game's length entered by player when this game was configuring, call gameFinished() If RandomEvent.athleteQuitEvent() happened and player do not have 4 or more athletes and unable to purchase a new athlete, call gameFinished()
      Returns:
      A message describe what happened during this method

    • updateInventory

      public void updateInventory(Item item, int newAmount)
      update inventory with a new amount of items
      Parameters:
      item - The item that amount changes
      newAmount - The new amount

    • useItem

      public String useItem(int index, Athlete target)
      Use the selected item to the selected athlete by calling Item.useItem(Athlete) and return the item effect message as a feedback
      Parameters:
      item - The selected item
      target - The selected athlete
      Returns:
      The item effect message as a feedback
